summary: An Ordinance regulating the gangways and gang planks used for the embarking and disembarking passengers upon or from boats or vessels within the City of Seattle, and providing penalties for violation thereof, and repealing Ordinance No. 4603, entitled "An Ordinance prohibiting the use of gang planks, without a life line or hand rail, for embarking or disembarking passengers upon or from boats or vessels within the City of Seattle, and providing penalties for the violation thereof," approved September 28, 1897 and Ordinance No. 7177, entitled "An Ordinance regulating gangways between wharves and passenger vessels, declaring violation of this Ordinance a misdemeanor and providing a punishment," approve September 4, 1901.
